title: Mexico Nears Deal to Resolve Pipeline Conflict
summary: If approved, agreement would allow the South Texas-Tuxpan marine pipeline to begin operations. summary: Businesses strive to understand mixed messages over where they stand with overseas operations. American businesses, from technology startups to large corporations, say they cannot quickly upend their supply chains and stop doing business in China.

summary: Fans of the soda fountain classic mix it up to save it. In the lobby of Manhattan's criminal courthouse, alongside metal detectors and snaking lines of jurors, Ray Lonergan whips up a frothy mix of seltzer, milk, chocolate syrup and nostalgia.

summary: Battle is now tied to campaign-finance-reform efforts; WFP leader calls it 'Cuomo's poison pill'. The battle over New York's fusion-voting system is playing out at a state commission overseeing campaign-finance-reform efforts, with the latest shots fired at a meeting last week.

title: Disney Stores Headed to 25 Target Locations
summary: The companies expect to add an additional 40 Disney Stores at Target locations by the end of 2020. Target Corp. and Walt Disney Co. have joined forces to open dedicated Disney Stores in about two dozen Target locations starting this fall, the latest example of a large retailer offering a specialty shop within its walls.

title: Trump Says U.S. and Japan Have Reached Trade Deal in Principle
summary: Deal would pave the way for more farm exports to Japan, while dropping the threat of U.S. tariffs on Japanese cars. BIARRITZ, France-President Trump said Sunday the U.S. and Japan had reached a trade deal "in principle" that would pave the way for more U.S. farm exports to Japan, while dropping the threat of increased U.S. tariffs on Japanese cars.

title: Iran's Foreign Minister Makes Unexpected Visit on Sidelines of G-7 Meeting
summary: Javad Zarif's arrival further shakes up an already turbulent summit. Iran's top diplomat made a surprise visit Sunday to the city hosting the Group of Seven summit, meeting with a delegation including President Emmanuel Macron as leaders grappled with how to defuse tensions and salvage a multination landmark nuclear deal after a U.S. pullout.

title: Israel Strikes Iranian Targets in Syria to Prevent 'Killer Drone' Attack
summary: Strikes come amid a broader Israeli military campaign in the region. Israel said it struck a military site in Syria to prevent planned attacks from Iranian forces, raising the risk of a clash with Tehran amid a broader Israeli campaign to counter the military activities of the Islamic Republic.

title: Central Bankers Worry About Trump's Tactics to Reorder Global Trade
summary: With borrowing costs already low, they have fewer options to spur economic growth. JACKSON HOLE, Wyo.-The world's central bankers are increasingly worried that President Trump's tactics to reorder global trade are destabilizing economies in ways that they can't easily fix.

summary: The Ninth Circuit stays a bad ruling that would harm 5G innovation.. title: Bernie's Green Leap Forward
summary: Cost: $16 trillion. Fracking: banned. Oil CEOs: in jail.. Bernie Sanders published his version of the Green New Deal last week, and it's written with all the realism voters have come to expect. Start with its price: "an historic $16.3 trillion." That's 10 times Joe Biden's climate plan, which is wild already. For the record, America's annual economy is about $21 trillion.

title: Smearing Steven Menashi
summary: CNN and MSNBC distort another judicial nominee's views.. The Trump Administration is nominating more federal judges, and right behind comes the character assassination. title: Economy Week Ahead: Durable Goods Orders, Personal Income

title: Audiobooks, Print Give Different Advantages
summary: While Mr. Austin sees correct prosody as a selling point for audiobooks, I see it as an intrusion on the spaces in my mind.. In "I'd Rather Read With My Ears" (op-ed, Aug. 19), Dale Austin describes humans as beholden to the written word and cites convenience and the lack of ambiguity as talking points (pun intended) for audiobooks. If Mr. Austin finds enjoyment in audiobooks, more power to him. It's still a free country. But I feel that he is missing the magic. Books aren't just sources of information; they are, or can be, wardrobe doors swinging open to Narnia, where ambiguity is part of the enchantment and inconvenience is the ticket to ride. While Mr. Austin sees correct prosody as a selling point for audiobooks, I see it as an intrusion on the spaces in my mind. There is a relationship between a book and its reader that excludes even the author, like a parent who must relinquish control over grown progeny, and audiobooks turn that cozy tête-à-tête into an uneasy ménage à trois. But there is one point on which I agree with Mr. Austin. I, too, prefer to read with my ears. It's just that the ears I use for reading are the ears in my mind.

title: Reward for Brave Wokeness
summary: Alert students, such as the New School genius who informed the authorities of his/her/its agony at hearing James Baldwin's actual choice of words, should be rewarded for his/her/its bravery.. Regarding Lance Morrow's "A Forbidden Word's Lost Lessons" (op-ed, Aug. 20): Alert students, such as the New School genius who informed the authorities of his/her/its agony at hearing James Baldwin's actual choice of words, should be rewarded for his/her/its bravery. I suggest that student transcripts include details of such displays of wokeness, so that future employers will be informed.

title: Hong Kong Protests Force Companies to Choose: Their Employees or China
summary: Employers early on supported their workers' desire to protest but have started to shift under pressure from Beijing. title: Ex-Congressman Joe Walsh Begins Republican Campaign Against Trump
summary: Former GOP lawmaker begins long-shot challenge to president from the right. Former U.S. Rep. Joe Walsh launched a long-shot Republican presidential campaign on Sunday, casting the current occupant of the White House as a failed leader.

title: The Market Gets What It Wants
summary: Its recent drop is like a tantrum, screaming at President Trump to knock off the tariffs.. Are you talking to me? The market dropped 767 points Aug. 5 on news of China's currency devaluation, then popped 311 points the next day on delayed tariffs, then sank 800 points eight days later after signs that the yield curve had inverted further. It's been yo-yoing since then-up 275, down 623 on Friday. When the stock market goes through these spasmatic gyrations, it's a desperate cry for attention. But what is it trying to say? Ya got trouble, with a capital T.

title: What You Haven't Read About Brazil
summary: The Amazon fires are mainly the result of drought, while Bolsonaro's reforms are paving the way for faster growth.. Brazil announced last week that it will privatize 17 more government enterprises, including federal electricity giant Eletrobras, the national mint and the postal service. Dozens of ports, airports, railroads and other companies already have been put in private hands since President Jair Bolsonaro took office on Jan. 1.

title: 'Free Enterprise' Review: A Motto for Capitalism
summary: Free enterprise was touted as "an old-fashioned verity" at odds with the New Deal's vogue for public-sector programs.. Bernie Sanders's jeremiads against big business and the wealthy have helped popularize an economic philosophy that, in America, has rarely had much appeal: socialism. Among Democrats, it is now viewed more favorably than capitalism, according to a Gallup poll published last year. But the poll also showed that, among voters of all stripes, capitalism still has a 56% approval rating. And Mr. Sanders's backers surely winced at the decidedly non-socialist phrase that was viewed favorably by nearly 8 in 10 people: "free enterprise."

title: Don't Hate Koch Because He Was Generous
summary: He didn't demand his beneficiaries march in ideological lockstep. His detractors do.. David Koch is dead. Long live cooperation across ideological lines.

title: The Weaponization of History
summary: Ignorantly invoking slavery or the Holocaust is an affront to those who seriously study the past.. History is the most humbling and humanizing of subjects. It opens reality to us in all its gorgeous variety, from the earthbound lives of ordinary peasants and servants to the rarefied universe of the mighty and wealthy, and the astonishing range of human experience in between. It seeks to provide a balanced and honest record of humanity's achievements and enormities alike, generous enough to acknowledge the mixture of motives that every one of us flawed humans bring to life's tasks.

title: Make Denmark Another Offer for Greenland
summary: The island is an important strategic location in a world that is realigning with unprecedented speed.. Buying Greenland shouldn't be a joke. It's strategically important in our ever-shifting geopolitical landscape. Its potential would be better used in American hands. If I were advising the president, I'd tell him to make Denmark another offer.

title: Don't Give Up on Biosimilars-Congress Can Give Them a Boost

title: Trump Gambles That Trade War Will Pay Off in 2020

title: The Bond Market Is Wrong. Inflation Will Return, Someday.
summary: Central bankers aren't entirely out of gas, especially in the U.S.. The bond market thinks central banks are out of juice and inflation will stay below target for, well, ever. The longest-dated Treasurys are priced for inflation to average 1.6% for the next 30 years, and German bonds for just 1.3% inflation. Both are testing the lows of 2016, when the oil price crashed and investors feared deflation.

summary: Patriotism, religion and having children rate lower among younger generations than they did two decades ago, WSJ/NBC News survey finds. title: The Wisdom of Andrew Luck's Retirement
summary: Battered by six NFL seasons on the field, a star quarterback chooses to walk away early. To watch Andrew Luck speak Saturday night, at a hastily-assembled retirement press conference in Indianapolis, was to witness a man unburdened. The news of his decision to abruptly leave the NFL at age 29 may have shocked some, but Luck did not seem tormented by his choice. He was subdued, tearful at times, but he also appeared relieved.
